review_title: You'll need to establish good relationships to move projects forward
pros: Despite the typical obstacles of working for a large, complex and publicly-funded organization, there are many dedicated, talented and highly-skilled professionals at The Ottawa Hospital. Focus on building cooperative and mentorship relationships with these people, as they will help you overcome the sometimes overwhelming red tape. When it gets frustrating, keep in mind the people who are on the front lines (caregivers) and those who benefit from your work at the very end of the line - the patients.
cons: As with any large and complex organization, the bureaucracy and overcomplicated administrative processes can become discouraging. You'll often become bewildered at how money is spent on seemingly useless projects and roles... I've survived over a decade here by focusing on my own work, which I enjoy, and building rewarding relationships within my own small team. If you are ambitious, go about it with compassion and diplomacy - this is not the private sector with infinite resources. You need to understand that time and resources are limited, and everyone (or almost) has more than their hands full. So progress happens slowly.

pros: many unionized positions options for OT opportunity for lateral or upward movement
cons: high turnover in many departments low morale high stress

review_title: Change is a good thing! (and mandatory)
pros: I'm lucky enough to work with a great team, who is really supportive and helpful of one another. Even staff from other areas all seem friendly and positive.
cons: Policies and procedures are needlessly complicated and convoluted, when an obviously simpler and more streamlined method exists. Resistance to change and innovation is disappointingly found at every turn, with no rationale for keeping the current ways other than "because that's the way we've always done it".

review_title: great working with the clinical staff to improve technology
pros:
- some really great people to work with.
- one of the most advanced healthcare institutions in the area with the most money to spend.
- seeing the faces of staff when improvements make their job much easier and saves them time.
cons:
- parking is limited. took 1 year to get a parking spot, then became a ~ 70 deduction per month.
- too many things going on in IT and lack of communication between groups within the department.
- some of the "long term" employees feel to comfortable and set in their ways to become innovative and explore new possibilities.

- recent healthcare cutbacks could have huge impact on the services.

review_title: A few bad apples cause double standards
pros:
The Ottawa hospital is currently going through many changes to "mature" and become a true world class healthcare centre.
It recently did not place in the top 10 among patient satisfaction and was a wake up call 
$$$ and attracting the best minds in medicine is all about reputation.
cons:
However there is still nepotism among management (I'll hire your university student you hire mine etc) as we layoff in the name of balancing the budget etc
There is also an issue with nurse management, many nurse managers are held to high standards and the units reflect this, there are however some that are scattered and unavailable.  Managers that seemingly are a figure head only? Highly paid political appointees. New head of nursing will hopefully clean this up.

pros: Wide variety of specializations practiced here
cons:
Nurse Mangers who can work part time hours because of their  dumping work on asst. managers/educators and charge nurses etc.
Intimidation and promises of promotions used to control inner circle.
Particularly bad in critical care areas (larger ones) easy for manager to hide behind staff and intimidate/bully them into doing the work.
Staff and resource cuts are used to justify increased workloads/poor moral - easier for poor management to hide

pros: Money and work hours
cons:
Pay increase to support staff is too little and overdue. 
Constant oversupervision of front line staff and nitpicking on frivolous issues and work performance by undertrained Supervisors and lazy Managers who support the poor decision making and professional harassment by inexperienced supervisors.
Takes over 10 years to become fulltime porter on a minimal basis if lucky .
Manager is very prejudiced to hiring more visible minority workers and takes forever to respond to workers complaints about workplace issues and suppresses worker complaints by targeting that worker.

pros: Great experience and hands on training in biomedical research.  Excellence programs for students preparing to do an honours project in biochem or related field.  Organized seminars to gain experience presenting and asking questions.  Exposure to graduate students for those interested in grad school. Included in the scientific publication process.
cons: Lots of work.  Unpaid overtime.  You do not work shifts, it is salary based and sometimes your experiments require that you stay late, come in early and even come in on the evening and weekends when necessary.  Pay is reasonable but not as good as coop opportunities in the gov't for instance. You must be a competitive candidate academically to be considered by most labs.

pros: Nice people to work with.and good patients who appreciate that you are trying to help them.  Also, the salary is very good.  I worked in several areas in the Civic ,both full time and part time, for 35+ years. And, I was the first job sharer in the X-Ray department and continued in that capacity til I retired in 2000.
cons: Working nights wasn't my favourite shift.  Lifting very heavy patients from stretcher to X-ray table without the aid of a transport machine or even a sliding board - very hard on ones back.

pros:
It seemed that they cared about me, and some did their best to accommodate me.

Some of my trainers seemed friendly and patient.
cons:
Trainer on my first day was very abrupt and rude.

Some are not patient with new hires, especially those with disabilities.

pros: Great CEO,  wants to change culture and attract talent, nice people to work with, respectful  colleagues,  great pension, very good benefits, some good perks, closed at Christmas for a few days and office closure at 2 pm on Friday during the months of July & August, work from home options are available
cons: Salary is low, building is old and sickly with asbestos, parking is limited and need to park off sight.  Organization does not seem to be prepared with update to date and current processes for new staff.  Difficult on accepting change, or building a new environment, advancement for growth is sparce

pros: There is a lot of oppertunity for advancement and change.  Most of the mananers are great and want you to succeed.
cons: Some manangers DO NOT care about anyone but themselves.  Alsway short staffed and sick calls not replaced.

review_title: Poor Management and Nepotism rule at TOH
pros: Good pay, many good coworkers, my job is fairly easy and fun.
cons:
Managers hire family, and friends, pick favourites. 

Constantly told that there is no money in the budget for more hours; yet TOH is constantly hiring new managers or manger type roles. While employees languish in part time casual positions. 

Union protects everyone including lazy employees. 

EX. Just last week I saw a co-worker sitting down and resting his head in is chest with his eyes closed IE. He was sleeping.   

Part time employees are allowed to take hours from casuals. 

When jobs are posted anyone from CUPE can apply. IE. A woman in catering can apply for a  part time or full time job in a totally different department. If she has the most seniority out of all of the applicants, and gives the best interview she gets the job. 

So someone who has been there for years, will always be passed over for a job. because instead of being fair, and keeping it seniority at the department level, it often goes to someone who has zero experience in the position, but will be trained. 

Oftentimes people from other departments who successfully get hired in another department quit before starting, or they complete their training and then they change their mind and go back to their old job. 

This costs TOH money to post the job, interview people, and go down the list when the successful candidate changes their mind. 

Oftentimes when you contact the union nothing is done, as they are part of the problem. It is in the collective agreement that allows the above to occur, and they do not want to change anything. 

Employees will have to work years and years to get anywhere as seniority and speaking French are they only way to get ahead at TOH. Unless you know someone.

Many people feel hopeless about their future at TOH. I myself have applied for over 300 jobs, and nothing outside of 1 interview, and a few tests has happened. 

You can suggest ideas to managers,  and they will listen; but 9/10 nothing happens. If they suggested an idea, it would be more than likely be implemented immediately or very soon after. 

Morale is down all over and I don't see TOH doing anything to really fix that. 

Mahogany row, where upper management offices are, is nice and new... with new furniture etc. Rest of hospital is old needs work. EX. broken drawers outside patient rooms, broken elevators that are constantly down.

pros:
Everyone can agree with the most important company value: treat patients like loved ones
Very good paid training for every aspect of your job
Meetings with supervisor are scheduled often and in a very relaxed atmosphere
cons:
Very long time before getting offered part-time (as opposed to casual on-call) work
Out-dated equipment
Work either in very hot or very cold environment

pros: I love everything about my work place, the staff are highly educated, carefully selected and very professional,  I feel like my employer care about me as a person and a professional.
cons: There is no warranty that you be working at TOH due to budget cuts and other issues. sometimes it is hard to get enough working hours.

review_title: Potential is there for a great workplace
pros: Salary was competitive, actually above average.  For permanent employees, the benefits package is outstanding.  Paid overtime and 4 weeks vacation.  Some great people.
cons:
Some not so great people.
Employees not promoted based on merit.  Can only move up if a more senior position becomes available, and then you must compete for it. 
Lack of support from management.

pros: In the Rehab Center of the Ottawa Hospital, my colleagues are wonderful, helpful, caring, truly a little family. The pay is fair, so are the benefits. I have heard others complain of management etc, but I have not had any negative experiences.
cons: There have been cuts made in the past few years, which means it is harder to get full-time work.

pros: Salary and benefits are a great reason to work for The Ottawa Hospital and there are plenty of different departments to transfer to depending on skill.
cons: Some management do not have a pulse on their employees and are stuck in an archaic and inefficient systems.

pros:
adequate benefits package
unionized environment
promote from within
cons:
difficult to get vacation granted
parking shortages
cafeteria is not open evenings or weekends

review_title: I'm so proud to work for TOH as helping our needy patients brings joy and satisfaction
pros:
stable workplace and great people to work with
TOH pays up to 93% of my salary for maternity leave.
cons: having to work (paid) extra hour or so occasionally due to workload.

review_title: Good place to work, but it takes years to get full time
pros:
- Good wages
- Best Pension in Ottawa
- Easy work
cons:
- Hard to obtain full-time employment
-All positions are granted based on seniority 
- Poor management

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Ottawa, ON
pros: Relaxed work environment, base salary is reasonable, friendly environment, education opportunities available (weekly rounds, etc). Unique travel opportunities when working directly with clinical trials
cons: No room for advancement, no direct connection to management, no salary increases other than cost of living, large salary variations between employees of the same job title

pros: Great place to work!  Friendly and considerate staff that work very well together!  We have a lot of respect for each other and all in full intentions of making our patients feel welcomed and ease their stress.
cons: Need better indications for patients to go to different part of the hospital!

review_title: A wonderful place to work at with a team that cares
